intro: Mesembryanthemum evolutum, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are often bright yellow or orange, blooming in spring and summer. It is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
